page.title: 20MOATS IN THE SAMPFORDS
page.content: There are many moats in The Sampfords. There are more moats between Cambridge and Braintree than any where else in the country.Nobody thinks that these were used for defensive purposes. Instead they were used to stop livestock escaping from the farm and for the livestocks drinking water.Also the moats could be used for washing water for clothes and for themselves.The water from the moats could be used for many other domestic purposes.The earth from the moat would be used for the banks.The moat also enclosed the farm.There are two moats in our rectangle,one is at Maynards and the other is at Howses.Cattle raiding was also popular and the moat ensured that fewer people needed to guard the cattle.{ {ALL THE CHILDREN OF GT.SAMPFORD SCHOOL HELPED IN COMPILING THIS REPORT.
